English: Grandma, raise me some chickens.
Pulaar: Neene baaba, ne'anee lam gerto.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for roosters.
Pulaar: Si ɗen ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e ndonto.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for goats.
Pulaar: Si ɗen ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e be'i.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for sheep.
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e baali.

English: I will exchange the sheep and goats for cows.
Pulaar: Dammi ɗin mi waɗtita e na'i.

English: I will trade the heifers for horses.
Pulaar: Nyalbi ɗin, mi waɗtita e pucci.

English: I will exchange the mother cows for dromedaries.
Pulaar: Kaabi ɗin, mi waɗtita e gelooɗi.

English: I'll trade milk for guns.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e pinka.

English: The bullets and arrows will be used to protect the cattle.
Pulaar: Kure e laanye, mi hiwira ndin jawdi.

English: I'll trade milk for ropes.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e ɓoggi.

English: With the ropes I will tie the calves to the stake.
Pulaar: Ɓoggi ɗin, mi saaniray nyalbi.

English: I'll swap the milk for fonio.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e fonnye.

English: I'll trade the milk for rice.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e maaro.

English: I'll trade the milk for corn.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e kaaba.

English: I'll trade the milk for millet.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e ngawri.

English: I'll trade the milk for mafé.
Pulaar: Kocce ɗen, mi waɗtita e maafe.

English: And my house will live in abundance.
Pulaar: Galle am heewa haarannde.

English: Grandma, raise me some cows.
Pulaar: Neene baaba, ne'anee lam na'i.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for gold.
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e kaŋŋe.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for houses.
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e cuuɗi.

English: When there are many of them, I will exchange them for books.
Pulaar: Si ɗin ɗuuɗii, mi waɗtita e defte.

English: Marabouts with answered prayers
Pulaar: Cerno'en du'anaa-jaabii

English: Will pray that I be blessed,
Pulaar: Du'oo mi wonta barkinɗo,

English: They will pray that I am loved by everyone...
Pulaar: Du'oo mi wonta muybinɗo…

English: For a boy
Pulaar: Gimol boobo gorko

English: I will ask the king's daughter in marriage and marry her.
Pulaar: Mi toroo mi jommba jiwo laamɗo.

English: I will give her pure gold as a dowry.
Pulaar: Mi teŋira mo kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe.

English: I will add a pen of heifers,
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon dinngiraa nyalbi,

English: I will add a hundred mother cows,
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon teemedere kaabi,

English: I will add a hundred bulls to them.
Pulaar: Mi waɗta ɗon teemedere ga'i.

English: I will put her on Bilqis's horse.
Pulaar: Mi waɗɗina mo puccu Bilqiisa.

English: I'll push the sun back a little towards the horizon.
Pulaar: Mi liiƴana mo naange ngen seeɗa.

English: I will give him into his hands the moonlight of the night.
Pulaar: Mi tammbina mo leelewal jemma.

English: I will make a carpet of stars for him like gravel.
Pulaar: Koode ɗen mi waɗtana mo koccu.

English: She has the braids of the Queen of Fouta,
Pulaar: Himo moorii moorɗi Neene Fuuta,

English: She wears the clothes of heaven,
Pulaar: Himo ɓornii comci aljanna,

English: She has the finery like Queen Bilqis,
Pulaar: O cuɗorii wa Neene Bilqiisa,

English: She perfumed herself with the flowers of paradise.
Pulaar: O urnorii piindi aljanna.

English: When she goes out, the sun turns pale.
Pulaar: Si o yaltitii, naange ngen sooyɗa.

English: When she smiles, night gives way to day.
Pulaar: Si o moosii, jemma on weeta.

English: When she walks, gold falls in her path,
Pulaar: Si o feƴƴii, kaŋŋe ɗen saama,

English: Friends and foes alike rush to pick it up.
Pulaar: Giɗo e ganyo adondira hocca.

English: The soldiers' bows protect her.
Pulaar: Himo hiwiraa laanye suufaaɓe.

English: Drawn swords guard it.
Pulaar: Himo reeniraa kaafa saafaaɗe.

English: The eye sees, the hand does not touch.
Pulaar: Yiitere yi'ay, junngo meemaali.

English: Everywhere she goes, people are amazed.
Pulaar: Ka o feƴƴi woo, yimɓe ɓen haawoo.

English: They wonder: "Who is this beautiful person?"
Pulaar: Hiɓe lamndoo : « Ko hommbo woni oo lobbo ? »

English: A court advisor replies: "She is the king's daughter."
Pulaar: Mbatula jaboo : « Oo ko jiwo laamɗo. »

English: The young people ask each other: "Who is her husband?"
Pulaar: Sagataaɓe lamndoo : « Ko hommbo woni gennda ? »

English: The Dieli and Gawlo griots respond: “Sori son of Pennda.”
Pulaar: Jeli e ngawlo no jaaboo : « Ko Sori mo Pennda. »

English: Enemies have exploding bellies.
Pulaar: Ayɓe ɓen, deedi mum fetti.

English: The young people all burst into tears.
Pulaar: Sagataaɓe fow, gonɗi mum hibbi.

English: I stand next to the lucky one,
Pulaar: Mi daroo moggo wela-hoore,

English: Young girls dance and spin, others clap,
Pulaar: Curbaaɓe ama no taaroo, ɓeya no kella,

English: People ask: “What’s happening in Fouta?”
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Ko waɗi Fuuta ? »

English: They were told: "It is the wedding of Sori, son of Pennda."
Pulaar: Ɓeya no jaaboo : « Ko jommbugal Sori mo Pennda. »

English: They ask, "What stops the stars from shining?"
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Koode ko haɗi jalba ? »

English: And the stars answer: "It is embarrassment in front of the lucky one's finery."
Pulaar: Koode ɗen jaaboo : « Ko hersugol cuɗaari wela-hoore. »

English: They ask, "What prevents the moon from shining?"
Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Leele ko haɗi jalba ? »

English: And the moon in turn replies: "It is embarrassment in front of the beauty of the king's daughter."
Pulaar: Leele kadi jaaboo : « Ko hersugol ŋari jiwo laamɗo. »

English: They even go so far as to ask the sun why it doesn't shine.
Pulaar: Hay naange no lamndee ko haɗi jalba.

English: He replies, "It's because of the bride's smile."
Pulaar: Ngen jaaboo : « Ko moose jommbajjo. »

English: Some shout,
Pulaar: Ɓeya no eewnoo,

English: The others murmur,
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sowndoo,

English: The others contemplate,
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sooynoo,

English: The others marvel.
Pulaar: Ɓeya no haawoo.

English: Everyone shouts, everyone whispers:
Pulaar: Fow no eewnoo, fow no sowndoo :

English: “It’s definitely her, the twin of this sun!”
Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni ciwto ngeya naange !

English: “It’s her, the sister of this moon!”
Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni jaaja nduya lewru !»

English: Grandma, raise me some sheep and goats.
Pulaar: Neene baaba, ne'anee lam dammi.

English: Grandma, raise me some cows.
Pulaar: Neene baaba, ne'anee lam na'i.

English: I exchange them for pure gold…
Pulaar: Mi waɗtita e kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe…

English: I became the husband of the king's daughter.
Pulaar: Mi wonii gennda jiwo laamɗo.

English: For a girl
Pulaar: Gimol boobo debbo

English: The king's son will ask me to marry him and he will marry me.
Pulaar: Toroo lam jommba ɓii laamɗo.

English: He will give me pure gold as a dowry.
Pulaar: O teŋira lam kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe.

English: He will add a pen of heifers,
Pulaar: O waɗta ɗon dinngiraa nyalbi,

English: He will add a hundred mother cows,
Pulaar: O waɗta ɗon teemedere kaabi,

English: He will add a hundred bulls to them.
Pulaar: O waɗta ɗon teemedere ga'i.

English: He will put me on Bilqis's horse.
Pulaar: O waɗɗina lam puccu Bilgiisa.

English: It will push the sun back slightly towards the horizon.
Pulaar: O liiƴana lam naange ngen seeɗa.

English: He will give me the moon of the night in my hands.
Pulaar: O tammbina lam leelewal jemma.

English: He will make a carpet of the stars for me like gravel.
Pulaar: Koode ɗen o waɗtana lam koccu.

English: I have the braids of the Queen of Fouta braided,
Pulaar: Mi mooroo morɗi Neene Fuuta,

English: I wear the clothes of the pardis,
Pulaar: Mi ɓornoo comci aljanna,

English: I wear the finery of Queen Bilqis,
Pulaar: Mi cuɗoroo wa Neene Bilgisa,

English: I perfume myself with the flowers of paradise.
Pulaar: Mi urnoroo piindi aljanna.

English: When I go out, the sun is getting pale.
Pulaar: Si mi yaltitii, naange ngen soyɗa.

English: When I smile, night gives way to day.
Pulaar: Si mi moosii, jemma on weeta.

English: When I walk, gold falls as I pass,
Pulaar: Si mi feƴƴii, kaŋŋe ɗen saama,

English: Friends and foes alike rush to pick it up.
Pulaar: Giɗo e ganyo adondira hocca.

English: The soldiers' bows protect me.
Pulaar: Mi hiwiree laanye suufaaɓe.

English: The drawn swords guard me.
Pulaar: Mi reeniree kaafa saafaaɗe.

English: The eye sees, the hand does not touch.
Pulaar: Yiitere yi'ay, junngo meemaali.

English: Everywhere I go, people are amazed.
Pulaar: Ka mi feƴƴi woo, yimɓe ɓen haawoo

English: They wonder: "Who is this beautiful person?"
Pulaar: Hiɓe lamndoo : « Ko hombo woni oo lobbo ? »

English: A court advisor replies: "She is the king's daughter."
Pulaar: Mbatula jaboo : « Ko ɓeyngu ɓii laamɗo. »

English: The young people ask each other: "Who is her husband?"
Pulaar: Sagataaɓe lamndoo : « Ko hombo woni genda ? »

English: The Dieli and Gawlo griots respond: “Sori, the son of Pennda.”
Pulaar: Jeli e ngawlo jaaboo : « Ko Sira mo Pennda. »

Pulaar: Ayɓe ɓen deedi mum fetti

Pulaar: Sagataaɓe fow, gonɗi mum hibbi.

Pulaar: Mi daroo moggo wela-hoore,

Pulaar: Curbaaɓe ama no taaroo, ɓeya no kella,

Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Ko waɗi Fuuta ? »

Pulaar: Ɓeya no jaaboo : « Ko jommbugal Sori mo Pennda. »

Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Koode ko haɗi jalba ? »

Pulaar: Koode ɗen jaaboo : « Ko hersugol cuɗaari wela-hoore. »

Pulaar: Ɓeya no lamndoo : « Leele ko haɗi jalba ? »

English: And the moon in turn replies: "It is embarrassment in front of the beauty of the king's daughter."
Pulaar: Leele kadi jaaboo : « Ko hersugol ŋari jiwo laamɗo. »

Pulaar: Hay naange no lamndee ko haɗi jalba.

Pulaar: Ngen jaaboo : « Ko moose jommbajjo. »

Pulaar: Ɓeya no eewnoo,

English: The others murmur,
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sowndoo,

English: The others contemplate,
Pulaar: Ɓeya no sooynoo,

English: The others marvel.
Pulaar: Ɓeya no haawoo.

Pulaar: Fow no eewnoo, fow no sowndoo :

Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni ciwto ngeya naange !

Pulaar: « Ko oo tigi woni jaaja nduya lewru !»

English: I will exchange them for pure gold…
Pulaar: Mi waɗtita e kaŋŋe siiwaaɗe…

Pulaar: Mi wonii genda ɓii laamɗo.
